request.description:
### Search recipes by calorie

Use this endpoint to retrieve paginated recipes filtered by their calorie content. The response includes basic recipe metadata (title, cuisine, rating, times) and a nutrients field with calories and other nutrition info.

- Method: `GET`
    
- URL: `http://127.0.0.1:8000/recipes/search`
    

#### Query parameters

- `calorie` (string, optional): Filter by calorie value using comparison operators. Supported examples observed in this workspace: `<300`, `>80`, `=80`.
    
- as **rating** is not specified,items are sorted in descending order by default
    

Note: Operators are placed directly before the number or value (e.g., `?calorie=<300`).

#### Pagination

The response contains:

- `page`: current page number
    
- `limit`: items per page
    
- `total_results`: total matching items
    
- `total_pages`: number of pages
    
- `results`: array of recipe objects
    

#### Example requests

- Filter recipes under 300 kcal: `GET /recipes/search?calorie=<300`
    
- Filter recipes over 80 kcal: `GET /recipes/search?calorie=>80`
    

#### Sample response (truncated)

``` json
{
  "page": 1,
  "limit": 10,
  "total_results": 4443,
  "total_pages": 445,
  "results": [
    {
      "cuisine": "Hanukkah Kugel",
      "title": "Harvest Noodle Pudding - Fruit Kugel",
      "rating": 5,
      "id": 7890,
      "prep_time": 15,
      "cook_time": 45,
      "total_time": 120,
      "nutrients": "{\"calories\": \"228 kcal\", ... }"
    },
    {
      "cuisine": "Tex-Mex Recipes",
      "title": "Authentic Fire-Roasted Tex-Mex Salsa",
      "rating": 5,
      "id": 8295,
      "total_time": 20,
      "nutrients": "{\"calories\": \"14 kcal\" ... }"
    }
  ]
}

 ```

#### Related requests in this collection

- search by rating
    
- search-total_time
    
- search-calorie (this request)
    
- search by title
    
- search by cuisine
    

These related requests illustrate additional parameters and accepted operator formats used across this API.

## Search recipes by total_time

Use this endpoint to filter recipes by total preparation time.

- Method: GET
    
- URL: `http://127.0.0.1:8000/recipes/search`
    
- Query parameter: `total_time` accepts comparison operators followed by a number of minutes.
    

### Parameters

- `total_time` (string, optional) — Filter by total minutes. Supported prefixes:
    
    - `>N` — recipes with total_time strictly greater than N minutes.
        

```
- ``` `` `=N` — recipes with total_time exactly N minutes (if supported by your backend). `` ```

 ```

`` `Examples:` ``

- ``` `` `?total_time=>80` — recipes taking more than 80 minutes. `` ```
    
- ``` `` `?total_time=<80` — recipes taking less than 80 minutes. `` ```
    
- ``` `` `?total_time=>1900` — extreme filter useful for boundary testing. `` ```
    

### `` `Notes` ``

- `` `200 OK with a JSON array of recipe objects on success.` ``
    
- `` `4xx for invalid operator or malformed value.` ``

## Search recipes (any parameter)

Endpoint  
GET [http://127.0.0.1:8000/recipes/search](http://127.0.0.1:8000/recipes/search)

Purpose  
Search the recipes by one or more query parameters. At least one search parameter is required; otherwise, the API returns 400.

Query parameters

- title (string): partial, case-insensitive match on recipe title. Example: ?title=honey
    
- cuisine (string): filter by cuisine name. Example: ?cuisine=Southern
    
- rating (number with operator): supports operators >, =. Examples: ?rating=>3, ?rating==3
    
- calorie (number with operator): supports operators <, >, =. Examples: ?calorie=<300, ?calorie=>80, ?calorie==80
    
- total_time (number with operator, minutes): supports operators <, >. Examples: ?total_time=<80, ?total_time=>80
    

Notes on operators  
Provide the comparator inline as a prefix (or equality as ==) to the numeric value, e.g., "<300", ">80", or "=80". Multiple parameters can be combined: e.g., ?cuisine=Southern&calorie=<300&rating=>3.

Examples

- By title: /recipes/search?title=honey (see related request: search by title)
    
- By cuisine: /recipes/search?cuisine=Southern (see related request: search by cuisine)
    
- By rating: /recipes/search?rating=>3 (see related request: search by rating)
    
- By calories: /recipes/search?calorie=<300 (see related request: search-calorie)
    
- By total time: /recipes/search?total_time=<80 (see related request: search-total_time)
    

Expected responses

- 200 OK: Array of recipe objects matching the filters.
    
- 400 Bad Request: Returned when no query parameters are provided. Example body: {  
    "detail": "At least one search parameter is required"  
    }
    

Related requests in this collection

- search by rating
    
- search-total_time
    
- search-calorie
    
- search by title
    
- search by cuisine
    

Testing hints

- Add different combinations of parameters to validate intersection filtering.
    
- If you receive 400, ensure you are providing at least one of the documented parameters.

Endpoint: GET /recipes  
Base URL: [http://127.0.0.1:8000](http://127.0.0.1:8000)

Purpose  
Fetch a paginated list of recipe summaries.

Query parameters

- page (integer, optional): Page number to retrieve. Default: 1.
    
- limit (integer, optional): Number of items per page. Default: 10.
    
- rating (integer, optional): Filter recipes by rating (e.g., 5).
    
- cuisine (string, optional): Filter by cuisine/category name (e.g., "Tex-Mex Recipes").
    
- title (string, optional): Filter by recipe title (partial match allowed).
    
- total_time (integer, optional): Filter by total_time in minutes.
    

Successful response (200) example structure  
{  
"page": 1,  
"limit": 10,  
"total": 8451,  
"total_pages": 846,  
"recipes": \[  
{  
"cuisine": "Breakfast Potatoes",  
"title": "Crispy (No-Fry) Potato Pancake Poppers",  
"rating": 5,  
"id": 6036,  
"prep_time": 20,  
"description": "...",  
"serves": "6 servings",  
"cook_time": 40,  
"total_time": 70,  
"nutrients": "{"calories": "204 kcal", "fatContent": "..."}"  
}  
// ...more recipe items  
\]  
}

Notes

- The nutrients field is a JSON string; parse if needed.
    
- Additional filters may be supported by the API; see other requests in this collection for examples.

# Recipe Service – New Request

## Overview

This request is part of the Recipe_Assessment collection and is intended to query the Recipe Service API. The URL/method will be defined in this request tab. This description documents how to use and extend this request without changing its behavior.

## Usage

- Ensure the appropriate environment is selected if this request uses variables like `{{baseUrl}}` or `{{apiKey}}`.
    
- Send the request to retrieve recipe data based on configured query parameters.
    

## Possible Query Parameters

- `title`: Filter recipes by title text (e.g., "pasta").
    
- `cuisine`: Filter by cuisine type (e.g., "italian").
    
- `rating`: Minimum average rating (number).
    
- `calories`: Maximum calories (number).
    
- `total_time`: Maximum total cooking time in minutes (number).
    

## Headers

- `Accept`: `application/json`
    
- `Content-Type`: `application/json` (if a body is later added)
    
- `Authorization`: `Bearer {{token}}` (if the API requires authentication)
    

## Authentication

This request may require a Bearer token. If so, set an environment variable `token` and configure Authorization to use Bearer Token with value `{{token}}`.

## Responses

- `200 OK`: Returns a JSON list of recipes. Typical shape:
    
    ``` json
      {
      "data": [
        {
          "id": "123",
          "title": "Example Recipe",
          "cuisine": "italian",
          "rating": 4.6,
          "calories": 520,
          "total_time": 30
        }
      ],
      "count": 1
      }
    
     ```
    
- `400 Bad Request`: Invalid query parameters.
    
- `401 Unauthorized`: Missing or invalid authentication.
    
- `404 Not Found`: No recipes match the criteria.
    

## Tips

- Use examples to document different response scenarios (200, 400, 404) once the API behavior is confirmed.
    
- Add test scripts to assert status code and response schema when you’re ready to automate.
    

## Change log

- Initial documentation added by Agent Mode.
